Key Match Events: Mitch Marsh and Marnus Labuschagne have settled the Aussie innings.
Marsh is close to notching up another half-century, and Labuschagne has played a perfect support role so far.
Marsh and Labuschagne had put on 57 for the third wicket, but that's just been broken by a disastrous run out that's put Marsh in the sheds for a run-a-ball 52.
Josh Inglis has brought up his first World Cup 50 in perfect style, with a beautiful straight drive down the ground for four.
Glenn Maxwell is clearly looking to end this match as quickly as he can.
Glenn Maxwell has given himself a couple of sighters and then gone on the tonk - he's now 28 off just 14 balls and spanked Theekshana and Madushanka in their last two overs.
Post-Match Reflections: Adam Zampa has revealed he took his four wickets against Sri Lanka while battling back spasms.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Adam Zampa has become just the third Australian spinner to take four wickets in a World Cup clash, following Shane Warne (four times) and Brad Hogg (twice).
